data: ICU Bowel Protocol for Spinal Cord Injured/Orthopedics Spinal Patients (Module)
Patient Care
Perform Rectal Check
At 0600h qdaily, perform manual bowel check on patient with neurologic deficit
Perform Rectal Stimulation
At 0600h qdaily, if the patient has a bulbocavernosus reflex, perform digital stimulation prior to giving bisaCODYL suppository
Perform Rectal Check
At 0600h qdaily, if the patient's bulbocavernosus reflex has not yet returned:perform manual disimpaction
Perform Rectal Check
At 0800h qdaily, perform bowel check for stool and repeat digital stimulation on patient with neurologic deficit
Notify Treating Provider
Contact physician for reassessment if no BM has occurred in the last 96 hours
Medications
Regular Laxatives:
PEG 3350 powder
17 g, PO, qdaily, drug form: powder
17 g, NG-tube, qdaily, drug form: powder
sennosides
24 mg, PO, qHS, drug form: tab
24 mg, NG-tube, qHS, drug form: oral liq
bisaCODYL
10 mg, rectal, q24h, drug form: supp, start: T+1;0600
If no bowel movement in last 48 hours
magnesium hydroxide 1.2 g/15 mL oral liq
2.4 g, PO, qHS, PRN constipation, drug form: oral liq
2.4 g, NG-tube, qHS, PRN constipation, drug form: oral liq
If no bowel movement in last 72 hours
phosphates (FLEET) 130 mL enema
130 mL, rectal, qdaily, PRN constipation
